So suppose I I want to build something in web assembly and I and I want to be
part of your community of your found your alliance what am I supposed to expect can you can
you summarize what am I getting from you if I become part of this as a
contributor as a member yeah I would say probably the most common path right is
perhaps your employer uh is interested in in getting started with web assembly and you're starting with a PC You're
brand new to the technology What do you do uh we recommend going to our component model book uh and and that's
got a really great guide on getting started Um the next thing to do is to select your runtime We have two runtimes
in the BIC code alliance Wasom time and Whammer Uh and then the third thing that you'll do is figure out how to build for
your chosen language So how to build a component or web assembly module in the language of your choice And so what you
would do uh is go likely to one of the componentiz uh uh language uh SDKs that we have in
the bike code alliance Uh most of those have really good examples in those repositories and you can walk through
the component model book also takes you through all of that for your language tooling Uh and so that will get you your
initial PC Um but then I think uh the next step in this path is fairly common
today which is they hop on Zulip and they've got some really great questions for all of us And so there's a bike code
alliance zulip that I recommend everybody join Um and I think we've got this really wonderful community there
where people are really active and and love answering questions and especially when somebody's brand new to the space
we're like join us Uh so so don't be afraid to ask your question Um I don't
